results.description:
Overview

Pachiokun (sometimes stylized as Pachio-kun) is a series of pachinko games starring Pachiokun. Most of the games were developed by Marionette and/or C Dream, and published by Coconuts Japan. Each game usually involves some brief story or cutscene to explain why Pachiokun must visit pachinko parlors and gamble over and over to earn pachinko balls. The player controls Pachiokun with a top-down perspective, and can select whichever machines they wish to play by walking up to them and playing them.

The early Famicom Pachiokun games were usually called Pachiokun (number). The Super Famicom games were all called Pachiokun Special (number). The series also saw entries on the Game Boy, the PC Engine (including the CD-based PC Engine CD-ROM2) and the PlayStation.
results.name: Pachiokun

results.description: Quell is a series of puzzle games created by Fallen Tree Games.
results.name: Quell

results.description:
Overview

FortressCraft is a series of action-adventure games that are very similar to Minecraft. The FortressCraft games are developed by ProjectorGames.
results.name: FortressCraft

results.description: The original Virtua Striker in 1994 was groundbreaking for its use of 3D polygon graphics for the first time in a football/soccer game, along with filtered texture mapping.
results.name: Virtua Striker

results.description:
Overview

Taito created a series of seven Jinsei Life adaptations for the Famicom and Super Famicom from the late 80s to the mid-90s. Each game in the series took the template of the Jinsei Game and added their own tweaks and video game elements to it. Several of the Super Famicom games even switch the focus from living an ordinary life to something slightly more off-beat such as being a corporate drone, or being a peasant during the Warring States Era.
results.name: Bakushou Jinsei Gekijou

results.description:
Overview

Kick Off began as a 1989 Amiga and Atari ST game which was released to rave reviews by the European press. The series would continue to grow for a time, even as series creator Dino Dini left Anco to create soccer games elsewhere. After Kick Off 3, Kick Off was relaunched a few more times but would never see a similar level of popularity again. Many fans felt the game Sensible Soccer surpassed it.

The series also received a spin-off: Player Manager. In this game, the player could manage their team between matches. They could then play as their managed team in matches which were based on Kick Off's engine.
results.name: Kick Off

results.description:
The Virtua franchise includes the following 3D Sega arcade series:

  • Virtua Racing
  • Virtua Fighter
  • Virtua Cop
  • Virtua Striker
  • Cyber Troopers Virtual On
results.name: Virtua

results.description:
Overview

The SimTower franchise (known in Japan as The Tower) is a series of games in which the player takes on the role of a manager in charge of building a successful tower.

The first game in the series is SimTower, which was called The Tower in Japan. The follow-up to SimTower was called Yoot Tower (known in Japan as The Tower II) and was named after the games designer, Yoot Saito.

There were two follow-ups on handhelds, the first of which is The Tower SP for the Game Boy Advance platform. The Tower SP was an enhanced port of the original The Tower, but with elements from The Tower II added. The Tower SP was the first game in the series released in North America to use The Tower name.

The last game in the series is The Tower DS and was released for the Nintendo DS platform. The Tower DS was only released in Japan.
results.name: SimTower

results.description: The Phantasmagoria franchise consists of two games: Roberta Williams' Phantasmagoria and Phantasmagoria: A Puzzle of Flesh. The two games exist in different realities, and their plots have no tie to one another. The series' creator, Roberta Williams, intended for the franchise to be a horror anthology populated by games with similar themes.
results.name: Phantasmagoria

results.description:
Overview

Gunfighter is a series of light gun shooters that are themed on the wild west. Both games in the series were developed by Rebellion and published by Ubisoft.
results.name: Gunfighter

results.description:
Overview

Sammy is one of the largest manufacturers of pachinko and pachi-slot machines in Japan, and since the Super Famicom era they have also developed video games that simulate these games of chance. The title of the games suggests that by "practicing" and finding a "winning strategy," players can improve their winnings at real pachinko parlors, perhaps even at Sammy's own machines.
results.name: Jissen Pachi-Slot Hisshouhou!

results.description:
Overview

A sci-fi franchise from Byking, Taito and Square Enix.

It mainly consists of a series of third-person shooters that debuted in arcades in 2012, featuring unique dual light-gun controls and online team deathmatch gameplay. The video game series debuted on PC as a closed alpha in 2015.

An anime television series based on the games has been produced. After a 2013 preview, the anime series will begin airing on Japanese television in 2015.

Similar Games

The 2015 Dissidia: Final Fantasy game for arcades uses a similar gameplay engine to the Gunslinger Stratos games. Square Enix's 2015 arcade game School of Ragnarok also features similar gameplay.
results.name: Gunslinger Stratos

results.description:
Overview

The Kuhga franchise is a series of 3 sci-fi shoot 'em ups developed by Data East for arcades, and ported to various consoles. They pit the player against the massive forces of the evil Ragnarok organization, who repeatedly try their hand at conquering the world.

The arcade versions off all three games were localized into English and released worldwide, but the only translated console port the west was the Genisis version of Vapor Trail. The PlayStation version of Wolf Fang will however be published in North America on the PlayStation Network as an untranslated PSOne Import.

Originally Ragnarok in Japanese, the name of the antagonist force was changed into DAGGER for the English version of the first game and then Lagnalok in the second and third.
results.name: Kuhga

results.description:
Overview

The Munchers series of games are educational games which range from math to general knowledge. The series was started with the game Number Munchers on computer platforms.
results.name: Munchers

results.description:
Overview

The Arena Football League, or AFL, is a professional American football league that began operation in 1987. Arena football differs from the standard rule format by limiting the playing field to fifty yards in length and eight players on offense and defense, as opposed to the standard hundred yard field and eleven-player formations. Considered a lower-tier of professional football, a few players, most notably quarterback Kurt Warner, have used the AFL as a springboard to earn positions on NFL rosters.
results.name: Arena Football League

results.description:
Miku Flick is a series of rhythm games on iOS.

As a song plays, the lyrics scroll horizontally, and the player has to swipe the appropriate hiragana character in time with the song.
results.name: Miku Flick
